pr_title: Dynamic Model Extends: Inherit Table Properties

timeline.bodyText: Don't use object here.  We should use generics.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: We should leave the methods getInheritedMeasures and getInheritedDimensions, etc.  They improve readability.  Those functions can return the correct type and in turn call getInheritedAttribute with the appropriate Inherit method.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
There are two standard ways to ensure ancestors are processed before decedents:

Standard DFS algorithm with a visited set and toVisit stack.
Tail Recursion.

Let's not do this with a single data structure that we both add and remove from.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Why not just call parent.hasParent here?  It improves readability
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: You technically don't need to add a table parameter (tab) here because it is available through closure.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: Having both tab and table looks odd.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: These should all be separate functions.  Having embedded lambdas all together like this in one function makes this hard to read.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: null as second parameter seems like the abstraction to commonize this code is not working.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: The last parameter recurseOnlyIfNull is a tell that this really ought to be two separate functions.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Lots of casting like this makes the code hard to read (and generally can be removed through other means).
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick - but I would invert this if condition and return early if the opposite is true.  Then the entire function doesn't have to be nested inside this if block (it helps with line length and readability).
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: shouldn't this be called on the parent rather than table?  Similar comment for other calls below.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: We first retrieve the measure list from current table and populate in the new HashMap in the getInheritedMeasures method. And in the same method we call it for Parent class too. Refer L-315.
replies.author: moizarafat

replies.bodyText: But we shouldn't need to add the measures for the current table (as they are already defined in the table).  We only need to add the inherited measures.  This reads like we are duplicating what's already defined in the current table.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need to cast to String here?
timeline.author: aklish
